title: Whistleblower
description: Jo comes to the Scranton branch to find the whistle-blower. However, three different people have confessed to Michael, Michael is protecting them, and the person most people think is the culprit is keeping his mouth shut.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on Youtube video] There is nothing wrong, nor will there ever be wrong with any Sabre printers. Case closed. [phone rings, Michael picks it up] Michael Scott, as seen on TV.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [high-pitched voice] I saw you on the news and I want to pinch your tiny wiener...  [normal voice] It's Packer!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OH! Pack Man, I thought you were a girl!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Apparently, there are allegations that Sabre printers can cause a fire. So they asked me to give a statement to the press. I'm like, what? All right. So I do it. It's on TV last night. And it's in the paper today. And it's online. And then I call Froggy 98.7, the request line. I talk to the host about it on the air. It's like, come on, people, enough.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody, we are at DEFCON 5. I am officially the second-most watched clip of the day on the WBRE news site.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What's number one?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that teacher who was wrongfully accused of being a pedophile. Now, we cannot let the pedophile win again! I would like you all to go to the website and watch my clip eleven times.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So instead of working, you want...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Come on! Get it up! That's what... let's do it!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, did you see this report that the zoo got a baby otter? It's on the same site!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Awww, it's kissing its mommy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, you have to see, this is like, the cutest thing ever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? A baby otter? Okay, um, count me in as who cares. It's not even that interesting a baby otter, it can't even stand up. [looks toward computer] It's trying to stand up... [choking up] there it goes.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Howdy. I hope I'm not interrupting anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jo! We were not expecting you!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: 'Course you all, no doubt, know why I'm here.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Turns out our printers are famous. They're all over the news. It's an interesting story. Cheap foreign printers attacking innocent Americans. Well, actually the, the real story isn't quite as racy, but uh... let's give it a go.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jo, I think that I know what happened.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I'm not sure you do, teddy bear.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, now I think I might not.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Not long ago, we discovered a defect in one of our printers, so we got a software patch and fixed it right up, just like that. I don't know how it works. But just as we were about to send out a letter to our affected customers, giving 'em free toner, and we keep 'em, happy, but somebody here, they liked that first story better. The one where we lose half our clients for no damn good reason! Whoever it was who talked to the press, they should come forward, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jo, Jo, I can assure you it was no one in this office.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Can you now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Absolutely. Anyone who talked to the press, please raise your hand.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [quietly, to Andy] Put your hand up, Norma Rae.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If you say anything, so help me God, I'll break off the temples of your glasses and stick them in your eye sockets.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So unfair. Even if I thought that our printers killed baby seals, I would not be a whistleblower. The Bernards, for generations, have silenced whistleblowers. It's how we made all our money. Woody Guthrie wrote a song about us. [sings] Old Mr. Bernard, old Mr. Bernard, who have you silenced today?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: [as Gabe hands out forms to everyone] It's a little form, says "I did not do it."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is no reason for anyone here to sign this, because I know everything there is to know about these people. I know when their birthdays are, I know what their favorite kind of cake is, I know what color streamers they like...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: All that's just birthday information, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yes, but it shows a bigger picture.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Why don't you come with me? We'll start out with the honcho, what'cha say?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: When Mama was working as a prison guard and something went missing, she'd ask one question:

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: So say we catch this whistleblower, what do you think I should do with him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We should give him a one-way ticket to Montego Bay, where they keep all the al-Qaeda.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Uh, that's, uh, Guantanamo Bay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. You put them in jail for a long time, you put them in jail for as long as you can.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Well, I guess we're all right, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want these people to really pay, I want them to suffer. I'd prefer it if they died, 'cause it's not right.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Hey Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, IT guy.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Mind if I get in there for a second?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, sure thing, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Just one... [Dwight pushes Nick's neck to the desk and pushes his arm up] Gah! Ah! Dwight, what the hell?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Apache persuasion hold, that's the hell! What are you doing to my computer?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The lawyers are searching our hard drives for information on the leak. Thanks a lot, Big Brother.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're with Big Brother? Okay, go ahead. I got nothing to hide.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, are they searching all our computers?

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Yeah. [Kevin runs to his desk] I already got to yours, Kevin. [Kevin runs back]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, that's cool. Sometimes... sometimes I run. I'm a runner.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Everybody knows it was Andy, and it is not fair for us all to take the fall for his big stupid mouth!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ridiculous, Angela. And like I'm going to believe one of his spermed lovers.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Look, he's been complaining about this for a while, it's not crazy.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Okay Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hold that thought. I don't want to waste your time, and I wouldn't dare waste mine. I didn't do it. Now, I don't know exactly who did it, but I have a list right here... [hands Jo a piece of paper] You should fire the following people.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Well, I'm inclined to believe you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why would I disparage a company that has made me rich beyond my wildest dreams?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Yeah, I noticed you've had a great year. Good boy... you turning that money into more money?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you referring to alchemy?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I don't like to tell a man what to do with his money, but if you ain't investing in property, then you're dumber than a dummy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not dumb. I'm smart.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Well, buy property. That's my advice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is there something that you would like to say to me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: About talking to the press?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I, I didn't know. I didn't do that!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay? I, I... didn't do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't believe you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I swear on the graves of my parents who aren't even dead yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's a little much. All right, all right, all right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't care, that's how much I swear!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I believe you, I believe you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know who's giving Darryl any crap. He was more bothered about it than me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you tell anyone outside of this office that the printers were catching on fire?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, I did. I, I was talking to this girl at a bar.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I think she could... sense my sadness, and I, and I found out too late that she... she's the copy editor at the Trib.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my god. Was she cute?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, god, Darryl!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I basically swore up and down that none of my employees did it, and then I find out that one of my best ones did. And now he's probably going to get fired for it. And if that is not poetic justice, I don't know what is.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Sounds like you were as blindsided by this as I was.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, that's...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: And we didn't find anything on your computer.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Except this. [hands stack of paper to Toby]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, wow, this is, uh, just a mystery novel that I've been working on.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I know what it is. I skimmed the first chapter. I'm just curious, why would a man who hates people want to have a relationship with a maid?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, uh, I don't know, uh...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: The way I look at it, there's only one of two reasons. He knows a secret about her that she doesn't know herself, or he wants to use her services to mop up after a murder.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh... yes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Write your own damn novel.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What was you? You were the leak?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. I'm talking to this woman at daycare...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She's telling me about all her amazing trip to Vietnam, I have nothing. I tell her our printers catch on fire, spontaneously!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why'd you do that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Her husband's a reporter.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So now everyone hates Andy, and it's this whole mess, and I don't know what to do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, just relax. Just need to relax.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I could tell Jo... or I could tell Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is a very good idea. This is good. Let's get all the bad ideas out now. Flush them out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You leaked it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know what to do! Do I go tell Jo, or - I don't want everyone to keep blaming the wrong person!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know what the best plan is, Pam. Oh god... my mind is going a mile an hour.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That fast?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Two whistleblowers... two! I always thought Darryl and Pam might get me fired for something I said.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Michael knocks on Pam's desk] Yeah? [Michael points at Pam, himself, and Meredith, mimes drinking, driving, then points to his watch and holds up five fingers] I weirdly know exactly what you're saying to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So see you in Meredith's van in five minutes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, you didn't need to actually say it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [in Meredith's van] I have never seen so many parking tickets.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right, this is just messed up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you know what's messed up? This situation all up in here is what's messed up! We need to brainstorm, we need to get out of this! Brain hurricane. Come on, think.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do we got?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [opening door] Hey guys, sorry I'm late.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're not going for yogurt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's okay, she's cool, she also whistle-blew.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Guys, I couldn't help it, it is so boring where we work. I mean, it's as interesting as a morgue. It might be less interesting than a morgue.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, it's as interesting as a morgue.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Of course I'm the leak! I think I Tweeted it! I can't control what I say to people, I spend the whole day talking! I mean, I video chat, I Skype, I text, I Tweet, I phone, I Woof...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Woof is a site that I'm launching to be the last word in social networking. For just $12.99 a month, Woof links up all your communication portals so you are always within reach. It's part of the dog pack, as I call it. But, look, why tell you when I can show you. [types on his phone] I just sent myself a Woof. [fax machine makes noise, several windows pop up on computer behind Ryan with accompanying sounds, including barking]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [on phone] Ryan, you have a Woof on line 1.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thank you, Erin. Woof!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, here's what we do. I say we just smash all the computers. We destroy the evidence. No evidence, no case.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wouldn't we get fired for smashing all the computers?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Okay, not all the computers, just our computers.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That idea sucks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think that's a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just don't say no.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Michael, you know you don't have to turn us all in. All you need is one scapegoat.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Uh, if you turn me in, I'm turning in Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's just what we need, another black man in prison. You know, let's just...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nobody's going to prison, okay? Um... all right, Michael, you need to convince Jo to go easy on us. And then we'll all confess once we know our jobs are safe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. You can count on me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sees Toby banging on the vending machine] Let me give you a hand.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm hungry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ready? [they pull the vending machine towards them; Dwight's phone rings] Got it? Oh shoot. Got it? [walks away, opens phone] Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Realtor
quotes.text: [on phone] The property you're looking at is in great shape. By the way, it has a very spacious basement office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Basement office? You mean like a lair?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Jo.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was thinking about our little leak problem. I was up all lunch thinking about what we should do to this individual. You know what I think we should do? We make 'em come to work, and we work 'em, and we make 'em sit next to all the people they screwed over. And, and we pay 'em but we make 'em feel like they did something really wrong. The one question I have is, do we give them a Christmas bonus? I say yes, it's Christmas, but right after they're back in the thick of it.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Michael Scott... what do you know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It doesn't matter what I know.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: If it doesn't matter, then tell me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Because I want to deal with it the way I deal with it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, deal with this. [crosses arms]

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Empathize with me for a moment. I came up here with a big problem, and now I got a branch manager who's giving me the silent treatment... Speak to me... speak. [Jo's dog barks] Come with me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [as Michael and Jo leave] Are you leaving? Oh, am I... should I continue with the investigation?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you going to kill me?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Hahahahahaha.

quotes.speaker: Realtor
quotes.text: [on phone] I just need you to come by later and sign a few forms.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Realtor
quotes.text: What time works for you? [Dwight looks across the street] Mr. Schrute, what time works?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cancel it. I want you to make an offer at seventeen twenty-five Slough Avenue. Make 'em an offer they can't refuse. No, on second thought, low ball them. Don't call me 'til you have it.

quotes.speaker: Realtor
quotes.text: But... [Dwight closes phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on Jo's jet] Are we going some place far away? I know you said no questions, but... I have an early dinner that I need to get to... with the Chief of Police.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I'm very relieved to learn it wasn't you.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: All right. Uh, Stan, you're up.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It wasn't me.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: What a rich timbre your voice has. Okay, I am prepared to conclude the investigation. And... you did it. [nods at Andy]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? Based on what?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Uh, just all the evidence. And it really seems like it was you. Can we all agree to say that it was Andy for now, and sit with it, see how it feels?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right. Sounds good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Guys, I think that seems a little unfair. I mean, I feel like we don't definitely know it was Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. You know, I mean, for all we know it could have been... Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have rights.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Let's just talk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am not going to tell you anything.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Honey, you don't seem like your normal self.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I'm going through a little bit of a rough patch.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Mama Jo knew there was something up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whole year, actually. My favorite restaurant closed down.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Oh, I hate that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And my new favorite restaurant sucks... I bought a video camera last year, and I was looking at the tapes, and there were only like twelve minutes that I felt was worth taping the whole year. And most of that was just birds in my condo complex. What is that? ... I miss Holly.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Who's Holly?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Holly Flax from the Nashua branch. Best HR rep that Dunder Mifflin has ever seen. It's not been a blockbuster year for me financially. My Blockbuster stock is down.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, I think that the real question is:

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I may have heard from an old client, and I may have immediately started spreading the news to other clients and potential clients, yeah. But I'm not here to talk about that. I am here to talk about Suck It. Suck it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gabe, I told you all about the printers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I mean, it could be you, Gabe. I mean, that's the point.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, it's totally obvious.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I think we all can agree that it's either Gabe or Angela. [flips a coin] It's Angela. Get her, boys.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Hey guys, uh, sorry to interrupt. I just wanted to say goodbye to everyone. Through Teach for America, I'm going to go down to Detroit and teach, uh, inner city kids about computers.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Uh, not now.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Oh yeah, it's just that my friends are in the car waiting, so I thought I would...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [quietly] Phyllis, what's this guy's name again?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't know, is it Shadow or Garth, it's something weird, I...

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: My name is Nick.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay, well, Nick, we're in a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Okay, look, I get it, people. I'm the lame IT guy, and everybody hates me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, listen man, you can't take it personally.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: You called me man? I just said my name just now, did you forget it already?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No... sport.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: You, you guys have fifteen parties a week, you can't learn my name?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey IT guy. Here's the story, champ. None of us have spent a lot of time getting to know you, okay? We liked the last guy, Siddiq, because he kept to himself, and we also thought he might have been a terrorist. You know what, I'm going to leave you with one other thought. Inner city kids use computers for two things, games and porn. So good luck wasting your life, lurch.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Thank you so much for that. I saw all your hard drives, and guess what? [gestures to Ryan] You're not a photographer. [gestures to Kelly] And you definitely can't fit into a size two. Darryl, man, you're on Facebook. Why you been telling people you're not on Facebook? People want to be your friend, man! All right? And you. [points to Andy] This guy, you're the one who told the press. You wrote an e-mail to the editor. I saw it, and I also saw a QuickTime movie of your little printer fire test on your hard drive. This guy's the snitch, he's the snitch. So that's it, check it out. [gives the finger]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're going to believe that guy?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: When I was growing up, there was nothing better than being a big old business tycoon. And I thought I'd break that glass ceiling and be a hero to all those little girls out there... and they'd make a Barbie out of me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm, hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I, did I sell cheap printers? I do. But if I have to go out there in front of the press and make one of them public apology recalls, I mean, it's all I'll ever be remembered for. Nobody will want to play with my Barbie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, I would be willing, under the right circumstances, to do that for you.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Oh honey, surely you don't want that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I, I surely do, and don't call me honey. [Jo laughs] You were playing too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm about to buy this building, you know.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: You don't say? I own a one-eighth share in a rental property down in Pittston.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, I'm one-eighths proud of you... enjoy that chair for now... 'cause pretty soon, you will be on your feet, at Buckingham Palace.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Phyllis, have you seen my bag?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [points to the ceiling] You deserve it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Look, I didn't want houses and schools to burn down, and children to die. Does that make me a hero? I...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [offscreen] No, it does not!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, it doesn't make me the worst guy in the world, either.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It does!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I wanted to say that I think it was very brave of you to go to the press.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, thanks. Yeah, you know, just seemed like the right thing to do.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to press] We at Sabre have betrayed the trust that we have built with our customers. We regret our slow response and our lapse in candor and judgment. At this time, we are issuing a full recall of all Sabre GH400 printers. We will not rest until this problem is solved. There will be no questions. Are there any questions?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Hey, I appreciate you reading that statement. You looked pretty up there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was fun.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I hope your rough patch ends soon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks. Today helped.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Well, give me a shout if I can brighten your life.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Hey, you could transfer Holly back from Nashua.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Let me see what I can do.
